result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher James Schuster

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Christopher James Schuster appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Christopher James Schuster.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request to Waive Prelim by zoom
**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 10-27-2022. "Granted." **
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Christopher James Schuster in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
The Defendant requests a prelim with in 20 days.
The Court adjourns.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:46 PM Defendant Christopher James Schuster in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Court quashes warrant.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
